sentences.sContent: We didn’t enjoy the day because the weather was so awful.
sentences.sCn: 那天我们很不尽兴，因为天气实在太糟。

sentences.sContent: ‘Why can’t I go?’ ‘Because you’re not old enough.’
sentences.sCn: “我为什么不能去？”“因为你年纪太小。”

sentences.sContent: Hubert never experienced any fear, and this was partly because he was not particularly intelligent.
sentences.sCn: 休伯特从来都没有害怕的感觉，部分原因是他这人不大聪明。

sentences.sContent: Many exam candidates lose marks simply because they do not read the questions properly.
sentences.sCn: 许多应试者失分只是因为没有好好地读题。

sentences.sContent: I decided to go with them, mainly because I had nothing better to do.
sentences.sCn: 我决定和他们一起去，主要是因为我没有更好的事情可做。

sentences.sContent: ...The snake has been named silver boa because it is metallic colored and the first specimen found was climbing a silver palm tree...
...because I’m going to graduate from college soon...
...“One of the reasons I find this topic very interesting is because my mom was a smoker when I was younger，” says Lindson-Hawley...
...Your identity has been formed; you’ve built up your resources; and now you have the chance to take the big risks precisely because your foundation is already secure...
...I felt powerful because I broke through my own limitations...
...because brains are more sophisticated than that...
...employees routinely complain that they can’t get their work done because they are forced to spend too much time in meetings or compelled to work in noisy offices...

trans.tranOther: used when you are giving the reason for something
